Events.RelatedBody: This avoid having duplicated sources between Mono and XA. The nunitlite.dll is simply merged into Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite so there is no loss of functionality or API.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Emit error when timing output is not collected" (#2397) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We are loosing useful data, when apk tests timing measurement doesn't work. As happened recently.

We should make the build fail, when the timing output is not collected. I will probably let the processing task fail in that case.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[android-toolchain] mirror depot_tools in Azure storage" (#2396) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
In 4bb4b2e, we added a `%(HashHeader)` value for invalidating cached
downloads in `android-toolchain.csproj`. It's primary use was for a
`depot_tools.zip` file, which is a dependency of building r8.

However...

Quite frequently we are seeing `depot_tools.zip` *change* and it gets
re-downloaded:

    Hash found using 'x-goog-hash', destination file changing to 'C:\Users\myuser\android-archives\depot_tools-crc32c=JBYDJw==.zip'.
    Downloading `https://storage.googleapis.com/chrome-infra/depot_tools.zip` to `C:\Users\myuser\android-archives\.depot_tools-crc32c=JBYDJw==.zip.download`.

Since we can't really count on a "version" of this file we are
downloading, I have mirrored it to the Azure storage account we are
already using for tests:

    https://xamjenkinsartifact.azureedge.net/mono-jenkins/xamarin-android/depot_tools/depot_tools-crc32c=JBYDJw==.zip

This URL will be reliable for our build, and we can update as needed
on-demand.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cookie Container not working on Xamarin.Android" (#2395) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We just made a library as Data Access Object for our Web Service using .NET 4.5 Framework.
That library will be used for different platforms, like Winform, Console app, Asp.net, and XAMARIN ANDROID.

We have a problem with the COOKIE CONTAINER when our Xamarin app on Android uses the library, the cookie container does not send the cookies to the server, but when we test with Console App, it works pretty fine.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[WIP][Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] refactor symbol files targets" (#2394) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
## _ConvertPdbFiles, _CopyPdbFiles, and _CopyMdbFiles

These targets were building incrementally, but not optimal:

- A `CopyMdbFiles` (duplicate of `CopyIfChanged`) was copying the
  symbol files.
- The `Outputs` of these targets were all being touched, after the
  `CopyIfChanged` call, even if they didn't change.
- These targets contained vestigial support for XBuild, was writing
  directly to `$(IntermediateOutputPath)$(CleanFile)` intead of adding
  to `FileWrites`. The file would continue to grow with duplicates on
  incremental builds.
- Several `<ItemGroup/>` transforms were duplicated throughout the
  target.

Changes:

- Removed `CopyMdbFiles` and used `CopyIfChanged` instead.
- Use "stamp" files as per our convention as `Outputs`.
- Declare new `<ItemGroup/>` values where necessary, instead of using
  wildcards or repetitive transforms.
- Verified that `FileWrites` was correct.

## ConvertDebuggingFiles

This target was not running during our builds at all: it was not
included in the MSBuild dependency graph. I searched various Xamarin
private repos, and couldn't find anything using it?

It doesn't appear to me that this target was quite correct anyway...
So it seems we can just remove it?

If we are nervous about this breaking something, I could leave the
target in here as an empty target.

## Xamarin.Android.Windows.targets

There is a Windows-specific target, that seems odd:

    <Target Name="_RegisterAndroidFilesWithFileWrites" BeforeTargets="IncrementalClean" Condition=" '$(_IsRunningXBuild)' != 'true' ">
      <CreateItem Include="$(OutDir)*.pdb;$(OutDir)*.dll;$(OutDir)*.dll.mdb;$(MonoAndroidIntermediateAssemblyDir)*.dll.mdb;$(MonoAndroidIntermediateAssemblyDir)*.pdb;$(MonoAndroidLinkerInputDir)*.dll.mdb;$(MonoAndroidLinkerInputDir)*.pdb">
        <Output TaskParameter="Include" ItemName="_FilesToRegister" />
      </CreateItem>
      <CreateItem Include="$([System.IO.Path]::GetFullPath('%(_FilesToRegister.Identity)'))"
          Condition="Exists('%(_FilesToRegister.Identity)')">
        <Output TaskParameter="Include" ItemName="_CleanCurrentFileWrites" />
      </CreateItem>
    </Target>

There are several things that seem wrong here:

1. We are using a private `_CleanCurrentFileWrites` `<ItemGroup/>`.
2. This is doing extra work hitting the disk, expanding the `*`
   wildcards.
3. I think due to use of the private group,
   `$(IntermediateOutputPath)$(CleanFile)` grows with duplicate
   entries on each subsequent build. This happened even after removing
   `<WriteLinesToFile File="$(IntermediateOutputPath)$(CleanFile)" />`
   calls.

What we *should* do instead:

1. Each of these files should add to `FileWrites` in the MSBuild
   target where they are copied or created.
2. Remove the `_RegisterAndroidFilesWithFileWrites` target completely.

I revisited the following targets to verify the appropriate files are
added to `FileWrites`:
- `_CopyIntermediateAssemblies`
- `_CopyPdbFiles`
- `_CopyMdbFiles`
- `_LinkAssemblies`
- `_LinkAssembliesShrink`

## Tests

`CheckNothingIsDeletedByIncrementalClean` - now validates that
`$(IntermediateOutputPath)$(CleanFile)` has no changes after a build
with no changes. It verifies it doesn't continue to grow on
incremental builds.

`AppProjectTargetsDoNotBreak` - added checks for these targets:
`_ConvertPdbFiles`, `_CopyPdbFiles`, and `_CopyMdbFiles`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Application crashes on emulators with android 4.0 or 4.1 (API 15 and 16) and architecture X86" (#2393) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Hello World application
2. Set target SDK version to android 9
3. Set minimum SDK version to android 4.0 or API 15
4. Disable 'Use shared runtime' option in Android options
5. Build and deploy the application on an emulator with API 15 or 16 and X86 architecture 

### Expected Behavior
Application should run normally

### Actual Behavior
The app crashes and the 'Unfortunately, some app stopped' appears.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Application crashes with SIGSEGV on android 4.0, 4.1 and 4.2 (API 15,16 & 17) with ARM architecture" (#2392) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new android application (just a Hello world suffices)
2. Set target SDK version to 28
3. Set Minimum SDK version to 15
4. Disable 'Use shared Runtime' option in properties->Android Options
5. Build and run the application in debug mode by deploying to a device or emulator with API 15,16 or 17 with ARM architecture (Wait! You probably can't deploy directly to an emulator or device with API 15 or 16 because of [another bug](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2391) ).

### Expected Behavior
Application should run normally

### Actual Behavior
Application crashes without even displaying the familiar 'Unfortunately some app stopped' dialog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deployment for debugging on emulators with android 4 fails because of wrong pm option" (#2391) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new android application project
2. Set target SDK version to 28  
3. Set Minimum SDK version to 15
4. Create and start an emulator with android 4.0 or 4.1 (API 15 or 16)
5. Build and try to start the application in the Debug mode

### Expected Behavior
Application get installed and start running

### Actual Behavior
An error dialog appears telling there was deployment errors. content of the output window is in the logfile.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "IntermediateOutputPath project attribute does not respect standard macros." (#2245) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Append the following parameter into yout Xamarin.Android .csproj file for the launched app. For instance, let it be MyProject.Android.csproj

```
  <PropertyGroup>
    <UseShortFileNames>True</UseShortFileNames>
    <IntermediateOutputPath>C:\Temp\$(ProjectName)</IntermediateOutputPath>
  </PropertyGroup>
```

2.  Initiate a rebuild.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The directory C:\Temp\MyProject.Android is expected to get created and contain what was previously held in obj directory next to the project source.

### Actual Behavior
The directory C:\Temp\MonoAndroid81 is created and contains what was previously held in obj directory next to the project source and thus several projects use the same directory.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Follow redirections to relative URLs" (#2390) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1923

When a Location header contains an URL that is relative or lacks schema/host, we
now use the original request URL to construct the destination URL. Additionally,
if the original URL contains a fragment but the destination does not, we append
the fragment to the destination.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Regression: native views don't lose their native parent when they lose the XF parent" (#4329) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set the content of a ContentView to a native view (use NativeViewWrapper or ToView());
2. Save the content to a local variable;
2. Set the content to null;
3. Add the saved content to another parent.

### Expected Behavior

The native view appears in another parent. 

### Actual Behavior

Java.Lang.IllegalStateException: The specified child already has a parent. You must call removeView() on the child's parent first.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.3.0
- Last known good version: 3.2.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[macOS] ContextActions on ListView not working" (#2881) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

The` Listview ContextActions` (Context Menu) on `ItemTemplate` are not working on macOS. It works on UWP, Android, iOS, WPF and GTK.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add `ListView` on `ContentPage`
2. Add a `TextCell` on `ItemTemplate`
3. Using this code:
`<ListView x:Name="items" ItemTapped="items_ItemTapped">
	<ListView.ItemTemplate>
		<DataTemplate>
			<TextCell Text="{Binding Title}" Detail="{Binding Resource}">
				<TextCell.ContextActions>
					<MenuItem Clicked="MenuItem_Clicked" CommandParameter="{Binding .}" Text="Delete" IsDestructive="True" />
				</TextCell.ContextActions>
			</TextCell>
		</DataTemplate>
	</ListView.ItemTemplate>
</ListView>`

### Expected Behavior

Right click on `ListView` item should open a Context Menu with the `MenuItem` declared. (As happen on UWP)

### Actual Behavior

Right click on `ListView` Item doesn't open Context Menu, nothing happens.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms 3.1.0.506097-nightly
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac 7.5.2 (build 40)
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - macOS: 10.13.4

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/joseluisct/ListViewContext

Opened pull request "[msbuild] Removes CompileEntitlements target inputs" (#5096) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Since we don't require projects to contain an Entitlement.plist file we cannot use that as input, because if that file does not exist the CompileEntitlements target will be skipped. This target runs the CompileEntitlements task that generates a new Entitlements file, and that file is required to deploy the app to a device because it contains the application-identifier entitlement.

Fixes #5094
